text.section:
With the written approval of the State Archivist, the head of a unit of the State government or of a unit of a county or municipal corporation may destroy original material that has been photographed, photocopied, or microphotographed if:
the head offers the original material to the Archives, but the Archives declines to accept;
the copy is made in a manner that meets the standard of quality of the Archives for permanent photographic records;
the copy is placed in an adequately accessible container; and
provisions are made:
for the preservation, examination, and use of the copy in a manner that the Archives approves; and
as to a record that a statute otherwise expressly requires to be kept permanently, for the copy to be available, on request, in the same manner as the original material.

section.section:
After materials are destroyed under this section, the head of the unit shall send to the Archives:
a list of the materials that were destroyed; and
a certificate of destruction.
The State Archivist shall keep each list of the materials destroyed under this section. The list shall be available for public inspection at reasonable times.
